concept.title: Introduction Writing Process
concept.shortdesc: This section provides a list of guidelines for writing an introduction narrative.

ol.li: State the formal name of the product or the feature you are describing clearly. Get the names right and use variables to assure consistent use.

Describe succinctly what does it does or how it works:
Be crisp and to the point. The key is to keep it short and simple. You just want the reader to get the big picture at this point.
Depending on how complex it is, you might need a high-level flow diagram, a process description, or a couple simple and short declarative statements.
Give an example showing how someone could apply the product/feature. If you do it right, you can start a base example here and build on it throughout the doc.
Tell the readers where to get more info (e.g., greater details, how-tos, and references).
